etymology.description: 手(手) (shǒu, "hand") + 臂(臂) (bì, "arm") = hand-arm -> arm
etymology.interpretation: The word 手臂(shǒubì) combines 手(手) (shǒu, "hand") and 臂(臂) (bì, "arm") to describe the whole arm, emphasizing the idea of the arm being an extension of the hand.

examples.chinese: 他用手臂举起重物(他用手臂舉起重物)。
examples.pinyin: Tā yòng shǒu bì jǔ qǐ zhòngwù.
examples.english: He used his arm to lift the heavy object.

examples.chinese: 我受伤了(我受傷了)，手臂疼痛难忍(手臂疼痛難忍)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ shòu shāng le, shǒu bì téngtòng nán rěn.
examples.english: I got injured, and my arm hurt unbearably.

examples.chinese: 他的手臂很有力量(他的手臂很有力量)。
examples.pinyin: Tā de shǒu bì hěn yǒu lìliàng.
